result.execSummary:
The defendant Miles Albert Eason was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miles Albert Eason

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Miles Albert Eason appeared by video.  Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin appeared by video for Miles Albert Eason.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant enters a plea of no contest. Court found the Defendant guilty. Court orders Defendant to pay a forfeiture of $25.00 including costs to be paid by 12-1-2022 or civil judgment for failure to pay.
Received and Filed. MATC Firearm Safety Course - Essay
Received and Filed. Community Service Verification
Received and Filed, Firearm Safety Course Certificate

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.

Defendant Miles Albert Eason in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Miles Albert Eason appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom. 
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Received and Filed, Waiver of Right to Personal Appearance
Received and Filed, Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights / Addendum
